perturbation.original_text: Each of the MG Capital Parties and the Company are referred to herein as a "Party" and collectively, as the "Parties."
perturbation.changed_text: Each of the MG Capital Parties and the Company are referred to herein as a "Party" and collectively, as the "Stakeholders."
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly defines "Party" and "Parties." The change introduces "Stakeholders" without defining it, creating uncertainty whether it is interchangeable with "Parties." Throughout the agreement, obligations are assigned to 'Parties,' so changing the collective term creates confusion on whether those obligations apply to 'Stakeholders.'

perturbation.original_text: (g) Company Policies and Indemnification. (i) The Parties acknowledge that each of the MG Capital Designees and each other member of the 2020 Director Slate will be governed by the same protections and obligations as other non-employee directors of the Company, including, without limitation, confidentiality, conflicts of interest, related party transactions, fiduciary duties, codes of conduct, trading and disclosure policies, and other governance guidelines and policies of the Company (collectively, "Company Policies"), and shall have the same rights and benefits as other non-employee directors of the Company, including without limitation with respect to insurance, indemnification, compensation and fees.
perturbation.changed_text: (g) Company Policies and Indemnification. (i) The Parties acknowledge that each of the MG Capital Designees and each other member of the 2020 Director Slate will be governed by the same protections and obligations as other non-employee directors of the Company, including, without limitation, confidentiality, conflicts of interest, related party transactions, fiduciary duties, codes of conduct, trading and disclosure guidelines, and other governance guidelines and policies of the Company (collectively, "Company Guidelines"), and shall have the same rights and benefits as other non-employee directors of the Company, including without limitation with respect to insurance, indemnification, compensation and fees.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines a set of rules as 'Company Policies'. This change calls the exact same things 'Company Guidelines'. This introduces a contradiction regarding which term takes precedence. If a director breaches a guideline, would the term 'guideline' be interpreted differently than if they breached a policy?

perturbation.original_text: The MG Capital Parties hereby agree to appear in person (including via permitted remote or virtual attendance) or by proxy at any annual or special meeting of the Company's stockholders held during the Standstill Period, and agree that they shall not participate or vote in any solicitation of written consents of the Company's stockholders during the Standstill Period (unless expressly requested to do so by the Board), and that they shall vote all shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by the MG Capital Parties at such meeting or in such consent solicitation, (A) in favor of all directors nominated by the Board for election and against the removal of any member of the Board, (B) in accordance with the Board's recommendation with respect to any "say-on-pay" proposal and (C) in accordance with the Board's recommendation with respect to any other Company proposal or stockholder proposal or nomination presented at such meeting or solicitation of consents; provided, however, that in the event that both Institutional Shareholder Services Inc. ("ISS") and Glass, Lewis & Co., LLC ("Glass Lewis") recommend otherwise with respect to the Company's "say-on-pay" proposal presented at an annual or special meeting held during the Standstill Period, the MG Capital Parties shall be permitted to vote in accordance with the recommendation of ISS and Glass Lewis.
perturbation.changed_text: The MG Capital Parties hereby agree to appear in person (including via permitted remote or virtual attendance) or by proxy at any annual or special meeting of the Company's stockholders held during the Standstill Period, and agree that they shall not participate or vote in any solicitation of written consents of the Company's stockholders during the Standstill Period (unless expressly requested to do so by the Board), and that they shall vote all shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by the MG Capital Parties at such meeting or in such consent solicitation, (A) in favor of all directors nominated by the Board for election and against the removal of any member of the Board, (B) in accordance with the Board's recommendation with respect to any "executive compensation" proposal and (C) in accordance with the Board's recommendation with respect to any other Company proposal or stockholder proposal or nomination presented at such meeting or solicitation of consents; provided, however, that in the event that both Institutional Shareholder Services Inc. ("ISS") and Glass, Lewis & Co., LLC ("Glass Lewis") recommend otherwise with respect to the Company's "executive compensation" proposal presented at an annual or special meeting held during the Standstill Period, the MG Capital Parties shall be permitted to vote in accordance with the recommendation of ISS and Glass Lewis.
perturbation.explanation: The original text uses the term 'say-on-pay' proposal to describe a vote on executive compensation. The changed text replaces all instances of "say-on-pay" with "executive compensation proposal". While these terms are often used synonymously, the contract does not explicitly define them as such. This creates ambiguity as to whether the MG Capital Parties are bound to vote in accordance with the Board's recommendation on *all* matters related to executive compensation (which could include things beyond a simple 'say-on-pay' vote). This could lead to disputes over the scope of the voting agreement.
